meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>blink</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to blink</vocabulary>.

This word is generally used in the phrase 瞬く間に (in the blink of an eye).
readingMnemonic: <reading>Mah ta-ta</reading> (またた) is showing, causing you <vocabulary>to blink</vocabulary>. I don't know what a "ta-ta" is, but I bet you could come up with something that's blink-worthy.
